section.name: News Archive
section.p: Here is an overview of all Wicket related news items posted on our front page .

subsection.name: January 25, 2005 - 0.9.17-beta released
subsection.p:
The Wicket team is proud to present yet another release of the Wicket core framework and its examples. This release contains major refactoring work and interface changes, including:
The Java API
Wicket component markup: <wicket:xxxxx>
Changes to web.xml configuration
Major updates of the javadoc
Please see the Hello World example for an update on the web.xml configuration. Also please check the examples project for more information regarding the Wicket component markup change.

subsection.name: December 26, 2004 - 0.9.16-beta released
subsection.p:
The Wicket team is proud to present yet another release of the Wicket core framework and it's examples. This release contains among a number of bug fixes also new support for dynamic languages, (see the
wicket-examples
project for more information) and for Spring framework
integration
.

subsection.name: December 19, 2004 - 0.9.15-beta released
subsection.p:
The Wicket team is proud to present yet another release of the Wicket core framework. This release encompasses a
big restructuring
of the package structure: the com.voicetribe package prefix has been dropped. All Wicket classes are now in the top level package named wicket .

subsection.name: December 19, 2004 - Going into beta
subsection.p: Finally the Wicket development team is starting the march to the big 1.0 release. This sunday the last release of 2004 is done. After this the release candidate circus will be part of our daily Wicket development.

subsection.name: December 9, 2004 - New style for the website
subsection.p: Our new layout, design and logo were kindly provided by Topicus by providing precious time of their designer Wouter de Jong.

subsection.name: December 5, 2004 - 0.9.14-alpha released
subsection.p: The current status of CVS was released under version 0.9.14-alpha.

subsection.name: November 7, 2004 - Clover license obtained
subsection.p: We have obtained a Clover license for use in our project. This allows us to obtain even higher quality code than before. Thanks to Cenqua for providing us with the open source license.

subsection.name: October 25, 2004 - 0.9.13-alpha released
subsection.p: The current status of CVS was released under version 0.9.13-alpha.

subsection.name: September 22, 2004 - Moved to sourceforge.net
subsection.p: Wicket moved from codehaus to SourceForge .
